newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: REED, TIMES COMPLETE FIRST PART SHEPARD'S BUY.
newsitem.headline: REED, TIMES COMPLETE FIRST PART SHEPARD'S BUY.

text.p: Anglo-Dutch publishing group Reed Elsevier Plc said on Wednesday it and The Times Mirror Company had completed the first step in their joint acquisition of U.S. firm Shepard's.
Shepard's, a legal citations business, was bought today by Times Mirror from McGraw-Hill in exchange for the Times Mirror Higher Educational Group.
As announced in July, Reed Elsevier and The Times Mirror Company will subsequently form a 50-50 joint venture to own and operate Shepard's.
The completion of this joint ownership of Shepard's will follow regulatory review, which is expected to be finalised shortly, Reed Elsevier said.
Shepard's posted 1995 pre-tax profits of $40.7 million on revenue of $86.3 million.

Reed Elsevier said in July its share of the venture's operating profit would exceed the attributable financing cost from the outset, before taking account of revenue and cost synergy benefits and associated restructuring costs.
